column1: Post-COVID recovery for rural CO healthcare is hard.  #PublicOption makes it even harder.  Expensive one size fits all big government plan isn't what rural Coloradans need! Great column in the Sun today by the Colorado Business Roundtable’s Debbie Brown: https://t.co/aP3rL0Vrkp

It's been three months since the CARES Act was signed into law. We understood then just as we do now that there would be necessary changes and tweaks along the way but already this critical legislation has helped and will continue to help millions of Americans battle COVID-19.

The #CCP hid what it knew about the initial outbreak of COVID-19 and is now hiding information about its nuclear ambitions. The U.S. must reign in China through effective arms control. https://t.co/hmcgnoJagz

Economic recovery from COVID-19 is going to be dependent on maintaining existing jobs such as the roughly 1590 steel jobs in CO's 3rd. I will continue to fight for steel workers who are critical to our nation’s infrastructure and national security. https://t.co/Mzs0DMzw1u

Approximately 90k good-paying jobs exist in Colorado's oil and gas industry but COVID-19 alongside Russia & Saudi Arabia flooding markets has threatened these workers and their families' livelihoods. It's critical ALL industries have access to lifelines to pay their employees. https://t.co/GPe1dw7VY7

During the COVID-19 outbreak my staff has helped 238 constituents—and counting—with SBA loans economic impact payments and other pandemic related assistance. I take great pride in my team’s ability to help constituents with any federal agency.   https://t.co/v5YZq6zA9M https://t.co/2xiRL2QT7B

Should the #CCP fail to cooperate with the U.S. or its allies on investigations into the regime's failed handling of the initial COVID-19 outbreak there will be severe consequences. The CCP will be held accountable—America will lead that charge.  https://t.co/kWQYk1f7Tb

Over 1000 Coloradans have lost their fight against COVID-19. Each of them has a name and family and friends who loved them.   Tomorrow Coloradans will unite by wearing a mask as a symbol that we will do our part to protect others & observe a minute of silence @ 7pm https://t.co/4vrRM6kwZY

We all know the best path to economically recover from COVID19 is to safely reopen businesses where the caseload is low and decreasing. @POTUS and his Administration have been incredibly responsive to our calls to address Colorado's most dire needs throughout this pandemic.

Evidence of #CCP's mishandling of the COVID-19 outbreak continues to pile up. After years of blatant human-rights abuses stealing of American intellectual property and manipulation of markets we must hold the CCP accountable! https://t.co/PSLSnBDIa7

In the midst of a public health crisis we are receiving reports of the #CCP attempting to steal critical information on American COVID-19 vaccination research. We must put an immediate end to this dangerous and reckless behavior! https://t.co/tECdoeRTMK

For Speaker Pelosi COVID-19 mitigation and recovery efforts are no longer about stabilizing the economy helping small businesses providing healthcare workers with essential equipment or assisting out-of-work Americans make ends meet. https://t.co/tcFn4AdG8O

On this #NationalDayofPrayer I continue to pray for a quick recovery to anyone physically suffering from COVID-19 facing economic hardships or otherwise coping with mental health struggles. May God keep you and your families healthy and safe in these difficult times. https://t.co/71Evv3pMjJ

The COVID-19 pandemic is again reinforcing the importance of responsible U.S. mineral development. During trade negotiations in June 2019 China threatened to cut-off our access to rare earth minerals. Now the COVID-19 shines a bright light on China’s dominance...

Colorado Veterans: Under Secretary for Benefits Dr. Paul R. Lawrence is hosting Veterans Tele-Townhall tomorrow @ 3pm MDT. The call will be focused on the #Covid_19 response and VBA program updates. To call-in: 844.227.7557

Rumors that Gov. Polis plans to use money from the CARES Act to backfill state budget shortfalls are deeply concerning. This money is intended to help rural and underserved communities during the COVID-19 outbreak and should not be used for anything else!  https://t.co/0bsw1JNzg5
Hope everyone is staying safe! Glad to talk about fighting for rural communities during the COVID-19 outbreak this morning with XRock 105.3 in Durango   https://t.co/BE9yRfJUx0

Why is #SocialDistancing so important right now? Think of it like dandelions in the spring. Hit them early and hard and you've got a better chance at managing them in the summer. Appreciated this take by Dr. France w/ @CDPHE during my COVID-19 town hall yesterday. https://t.co/Zs8j4GzmU8

Great to see the community efforts to protect small businesses. I am also working to provide relief for already stretched Critical Access Hospitals and rural Community Health Centers.  COVID-19 is temporary we will get through this. #InItTogether  https://t.co/MyQnWhwYQ1

Communities around Colorado's Third are stepping up to help those in need. Great to see such generosity everywhere! We are all in this together.  More uplifting stories from around the district amid the COVID-19 outbreak here: https://t.co/wzUQpkhjzt https://t.co/S9qJM8mPIY
We CANNOT FORGET rural America in our fight against COVID-19. Great to join @Varneyco this morning to talk about the efforts to stand up for underserved areas in Colorado. https://t.co/Z3qiCDq4z2

My staff and I are working around the clock to expedite delivery of resources to combat COVID-19 in rural Colorado.   In the meantime let's continue to listen to the experts:  Wash Your Hands  Practice Social Distancing  Stay informed: https://t.co/hsQErcusoE https://t.co/81ZRJyny6b

On Sunday when a bipartisan deal was close to the finish line Colorado had 591 cases of COVID-19.  The count has since surpassed 700.   We are wasting time and putting lives at risk. Taking advantage of a crisis to satisfy long-held political goals betrays every family in need.

This is a positive start for rural Community Health Centers in the Third District! I will keep working to ensure rural needs are at the forefront of every conversation regarding COVID-19 relief.  https://t.co/QfR4YIme7y

Mountain communities and rural areas are in desperate need of swift action to help mitigate future spreading of COVID-19. We must continue to heed the advice of experts. Doing so now will save lives and expedite the recovery process. Praying for the best in San Miguel County. https://t.co/AQFoDTbZDb

I have asked my staff to follow local guidance on teleworking. If you need assistance with a federal agency or have any questions on resources for Coronavirus relief please call ahead to avoid unnecessary travel. My team will follow up with you within the day.
We must all do our best to help stop the spread of COVID-19. This was no doubt a difficult business decision but the right call. https://t.co/xRBgshiVrb

Proud of the display of unity tonight but the battle is far from over. We must heed the recommendations of the experts and listen to the communities working on the front lines. #COVIDー19  https://t.co/i3UW8gU1uX

The effort to minimize spreading of COVID-19 weighs largely on Americans doing their part. Washing hands knowing the symptoms and keeping up with the most up-to-date information from federal state and local health agencies are critical! https://t.co/hsQErcusoE https://t.co/aDNkrBzhp2

Another reminder from @CDPHE:   The risk of COVID19 is not at all concerned with race ethnicity or nationality. Blaming others will not help fight the illness. Seeking and sharing accurate information will.  https://t.co/l3rsrhBnBm https://t.co/oVFa3agv5t

3 new cases of #COVID19 in Colorado 2 in CO-03. Please keep an eye out for the latest updates from local state and federal agencies so you can take appropriate measures to protect yourself and your families!

Quick reminder for everyone on #COVID19  1. The risk to contract remains low to the general public - does not mean you shouldn't take the outbreak seriously.  2. The virus continues to spread- should not sound alarm for public panic.  Stay informed & be wary of misinformation!
I will keep fighting to ensure rural Coloradans have the resources needed should the outbreak worsen.   My office has a website with up-to-date information on COVID19 here ⬇️https://t.co/hsQErcusoE

As CO embraces two 'presumptive-positive' cases of COVID19 my staff and I have been in contact with hospitals and health centers across the district to make sure they are as prepared as possible for a worst-case scenario. I am glad to report the overall sentiment is positive.

The overall risk of contracting Coronavirus for the general public remains very low. Stay informed with the latest updates from @CDCgov & @CDPHE.  Resources from both agencies are now available on my website here⬇️ https://t.co/hsQErcusoE

Thankfully there are ZERO confirmed cases of #COVID19 in CO! I will continue working with health centers across rural CO and state & federal agencies to make sure we are well prepared for any potential outbreaks! Keep up with the latest information here➡️ https://t.co/JuwJDgHpXA https://t.co/DEmsZeI2f6
Some helpful tips on preventing the spread of respiratory illnesses:   🚫 🤝 if 🤒  🚫 👉👀 👃 or 👄  ✅ 🧼 🖐🤚   Stay up to date with the latest on #COVID19 @ https://t.co/Sd4m3mW03E https://t.co/B8Mh2TQiDA
